intro: Cicerbita subplumosa, commonly known as the downy celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has a rosette of lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. Cicerbita subplumosa is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade.
